ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral mixed hearing loss (Otosclerosis)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of otosclerosis and unsuccessful stapedectomy; audiometry shows mixed loss with significant air-bone gaps; absent acoustic reflexes.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech recognition abilities at suprathreshold levels.
To assess reflex pathways and confirm conductive component.
To evaluate functional performance in noise with amplification.
To quantify subjective benefit and satisfaction with hearing aids.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Baseline evaluation confirms bilateral moderately severe to severe mixed hearing loss with air-bone gaps and absent reflexes, consistent with otosclerosis history. While objective aided performance with current BTEs is good, the patient reports significant dissatisfaction with cosmetics and feedback.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral moderately severe to severe mixed hearing loss with significant air-bone gaps (500-4000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Word Recognition Scores (WRS) of 100% bilaterally at 100 dB HL.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes at 500 to 4000 Hz bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: Aided (Bilateral BTEs): SRT Quiet 50.3 dB HL, SRT Noise 2.0 dB SNR; SRS Quiet 98.0%, SRS Noise 82.6%.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: One-year post-activation of the Right FIHD. Objective testing indicates the FIHD (Right) combined with a BTE (Left) provides speech recognition equivalent to bilateral BTEs. Aided thresholds are improved but limited by the device noise floor. Subjective satisfaction is significantly improved.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Unaided thresholds unchanged. Aided soundfield thresholds (Right FIHD + Left M75) improved but limited to ~30 dB HL floor due to microphone noise.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: Aided (Right FIHD + Left BTE): SRT Quiet 51.8 dB HL, SRT Noise 1.7 dB SNR; SRS Quiet 98.0%, SRS Noise 84.5%.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: APHAB Global Rating 80 (>95th percentile); SADL Global Score 5.25 (>80th percentile).

proposed_items: Surgical implantation of Otologics Carina Fully Implantable Hearing Device (FIHD) in the right ear
Continued use of conventional BTE hearing aid in the left ear
counseling_actions: Discuss risks of FIHD surgery including device failure, extrusion, and general anesthesia
Explain MRI safety protocols required for the implant
Counsel on the expected 'floor' of hearing around 30 dB HL due to microphone noise
Advise that objective performance may be similar to conventional aids, but cosmetics and comfort may improve
Discuss sleeping positions to avoid pressure on the implant

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for surgical implantation of FIHD as per patient preference and candidacy.

follow_up_plan.objective: Assess objective performance and subjective benefit of the FIHD.

expected_outcome: Patient reports satisfaction with the FIHD on the right ear and uses it for approximately 10 hours per day.
Patient continues to use the M75 aid on the left ear for better localization and speech recognition in noise.
Stable unaided and aided performance observed over more than 4 years of use.
Long-term satisfaction with the FIHD is maintained.
